nodes.text: Timon Medon Plaza was a plaza in Pau City on Utapau, named after Timon Medon, the Unifier of Utapau. Timon was responsible for uniting the Pau'ans and the Utai together in the early history of Utapau's civilization. The plaza was a large open space dominated by a central spire rising from the rocky ground.
The Timon Medon Plaza was located to the right of the Utapau Council Chambers. The Utapau Council was directed by Administrator Tion Medon, a descendant of Timon.
